ygData.subject: RE: RE: Anyone on this list?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm interesting, and I see your point, but at the same time, a person doesn t spend 1000 s of plat and literally days of online time working up to the point
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm interesting, and I see your point, but at the same time, a person
doesn't spend 1000's of plat and literally "days" of online time working up
to the point of sewing patchwork.. To stick with your analogy, would I hit
combine for some newbie that walked up to me and asked if I would please
combine the parts he just worked getting for his new Hickory or maybe even
the Elm bow? Sure I would say and not even charge him... But when you need
to have almost 200 in the skill to do what these people are saying, then I
have to say "Nope, it's gonna cost you." I am willing to work deals though,
I have done them in exchange for 20 microservos and 10 dwarven wires for
instance (for one bow) and so on, but for FREE, no I don't think so,
especially after you call me a name *grins*

Vpan, Master Fletcher, POVAR


-----Original Message-----
From: vagabond@... [mailto:vagabond@...]
Sent: Monday, July 19, 1999 2:47 PM
To: EQ_Fletchers@onelist.com
Subject: Re: RE: [EQ_Fletchers] Anyone on this list?


From: vagabond@...

I disagree with one of your statements: there will be no market. Rangers
are
not the only ones that use bows. I know many rogues and warriors that use
them
also. I am in-fact one of those rogues. For us, while we drool over the
Trueshot Bow, we can't use it. And that leaves plenty of room for profit.

Of course, I also think that your solution for your friends (where they give
you

extra sets of the items) is the one I will be using for everyone when/if I
get
to that lvl of ability on fleching....

It all comes down to personal preference. (on my tailor character, I made
patchwork at cost, they give me a pelt and a pattern, I make an item. All
because I was below the break even point on PW at that
time)
